intro: Oldenlandia glabella, commonly known as the "shameful face" or "devil's bit," is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers and distinctive, hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
